text: A tebibyte (TiB) is a unit of measurement in computers and similar electronic devices. Tebibytes hold 1024 gibibytes (GiB) or 1,099,511,627,776 bytes, equivalent to 240 bytes. Some people incorrectly call this number of bytes a terabyte, which is actually one trillion bytes, or 1000 gigabytes (GB). 1024 tebibytes make one pebibyte. == Related pages == * Kibibyte * Mebibyte * Gibibyte * Pebibyte Category:Units of information
title: Tebibyte
